noun.description: An idea that is taken to be true, and often used as the basis for other ideas, although it is not known for certain.
Behavior perceived as arrogant, disrespectful, and transgressing the limits of what is permitted or appropriate.
examples: he lifted her off the ground, and she was enraged at his presumption

origin: Middle English: from Old French presumpcion, from Latin praesumptio(n-) anticipation, from the verb praesumere (see presume).
